Job Overview How do we measure the effectiveness of our marketing campaigns? Are we sending the right messages to our consumers? Can we successfully optimize our marketing campaigns in real-time? What is the right level of personalization we can use to reach consumers more effectively? These are the types of questions that the Keurig Dr Pepper Marketing Data Science team is answering on a daily basis. The Marketing Data Science team is growing and If this sounds like the type of problems you want to solve then you might be a great fit for our newest opening. As a Principal Data Scientist, you will: Utilize statistical learning, and econometric techniques to glean patterns and opportunities in the shopper and consumer landscape; Create targeted audience segmentations; and Use various predictive and explanatory modeling techniques to develop data science prototype models that enhance decision making and brand experience. This position will work strategically with partners from brand marketing, shopper marketing, media, the commercial organization, market research, and ecommerce to make a meaningful impact on our business. Our department is enabling the future state of marketing at KDP and we need business savvy data scientists to do so. Responsibilities Develop at-scale solutions for measurement, digital audience targeting, personalization, hypothesis testing, and optimization that appropriately apply current research, machine learning algorithms, statistical modeling, and fully-specified econometric modeling Oversee data science projects through the project lifecycle, from scoping through to implementation Applies strategic thinking and the power of advanced analytics to answer tough business questions Interface with decision-makers to identify business decisions that require data-driven approach Scope data science projects to maximize business impact and ensure that projects are completed on time, within budget, and to user's satisfaction Navigate many cross-functional stakeholders, and communicates technical results effectively to non-technical audiences Investigate and modify business assumptions Ensure data and code integrity by conducting documentation and code reviews Recruit, guide, coach and train junior analytics team members with the ultimate objective of driving growth through best-in-class Data Science solutions Requirements MS/PhD. Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or related applied quantitative field (Bachelor’s in a highly quantitative/STEM field considered with the right experience) Quantitative MBA candidates will be considered 4+ years hands-on industry (non-academic) experience in Data Science (or equivalent quantitative job title) 3+ years utilizing Python, or R for data science solutions Experience with regularized regression, random forest, boosting methods, and several other statistical/machine learning methods Experience ingesting and manipulating large volumes of data (both tall and wide) Experience with multiple analytical toolsets and evidence of tool agility Proven track record of business integration of Data Science solutions Experience implementing hierarchical Bayesian or other Bayesian models is a plus Company Overview Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) is a leading coffee and beverage company in North America with dual headquarters in Burlington, MA and Plano, TX, with annual revenue in excess of $11 billion. KDP holds leadership positions in soft drinks, specialty coffee and tea, water, juice and juice drinks and mixers, and markets the #1 single serve coffee brewing system in the U.S. The Company maintains an unrivaled distribution system that enables its portfolio of more than 125 owned, licensed and partner brands to be available nearly everywhere people shop and consume beverages. With a wide range of hot and cold beverages that meet virtually any consumer need, KDP key brands include Keurig®, Dr Pepper®, Green Mountain Coffee Roasters®, Canada Dry®, Snapple®, Bai®, Mott’s® and The Original Donut Shop®. The Company employs more than 25,000 employees and operates more than 120 offices, manufacturing plants, warehouses and distribution centers across North America. Job Overview As a modern beverage company, Keurig Dr. Pepper (NASDAQ: KDP) was the first to bring hot and cold beverages together at scale. We are building on our position as the innovation leader in appliances to deliver the next generation of Keurig® machines to brew the love for our consumers and customers. Our Keurig® appliances implement advanced technology to bring our consumers a consistently perfect cup and we’re on a journey to engineer an even better cup of coffee while bringing our consumers the most simple and exceptional beverage experience yet. As part of our Appliance Global Product Organization, you will be at the heart of a team that is transforming our iconic brand for the next era. Keurig Brewers utilize advanced technology to provide the Perfect Cup, in every cup. The Machine Learning Ops and Data Engineer is a vital role in the Keurig Connected appliance initiative. The role will be responsible for building and maintaining next generation ML platform and data pipelines. The role will work closely with technical leads, infrastructure engineers, data scientists, and ML engineers in the Advanced Development team and work with the team to define, design and implement algorithms and machine learning software for the next generation of the residential and commercial series of Keurig smart brewers. The Machine Learning Ops and Data Engineer will report to the Director of Engineering responsible for development of Keurig Dr Pepper Appliance systems. This role will be a blend of both hands-on development and execution. This product development team is responsible for end-to-end research, design, manufacture, and delivery of all beverage appliances for the At Home and Away from Home market segments. We expect all of our employees to exemplify our strong company values of “Team First”, “Deliver Big”, “Think Bold” and “Be Fearless and Fair” in their daily work. To support you on your journey, our facilities provide state-of-the-art technology, equipment, and workspaces. We also offer a competitive benefits package, training, and mentoring by our executive team. Responsibilities: Lead a team in building tooling and automation to support the entire ML engineering lifecycle from experimentation to production operations including model training, deployment, usage, and analysis. Build production ready systems for processing data, data segmentation, running experiments, managing artifacts, data store, and data analysis. Design the data pipelines and engineering infrastructure to support machine learning systems at scale including optimization, explainability, automated retraining, version tracking, data archival and version management, as well as model and drift monitoring. Work cross functionally with engineers and data scientists to create and innovate new solutions Contribute as a hands-on Individual Contributor or Project Lead committed to team success, willing to do the simple or complicated tasks to move a project forward Support the integration of compute vision and machine learning technologies into the Keurig Connected Brewer programs, performing knowledge transfers, trainings, bug fixes, feature enhancements, and documentation as needed Requirements Deep quantitative/programming background with degree in a highly analytical discipline, like Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Operations Research, Physics, or related domain and/or equivalent industry experience 2+ years of hands-on production experience with end-to-end ML workflows in a cloud environment (i.e. on top of Google Cloud Vertex, Kubeflow, AWS SageMaker, or a custom solution) Experience with MLOps tools such as ModelDB, Kubeflow, Pachyderm, and Data Version Control (DVC). Proficiency with a high-level programming language (Python/C++) Proficiency in working with cloud computing and database systems Proficiency in building end-to-end systems as a Platform Engineer including ML DevOps Experience training machine learning models in frameworks like Tensorflow, PyTorch, Keras Familiarity with the full life cycle of software development, from design and implementation to testing and deployment. The communication skills to work collaboratively to prototype, develop, and implement new technologies Excellent communication, analytical reasoning, decision making and problem-solving skills desired Bonus Points for: Experience in the consumer product space Experience in developing services, databases and interfaces exposing ML to endpoints. A strong sense of curiosity and a desire to both learn and share knowledge with your peers. Proficient with Cloud Platform services and microservices concepts. #KDPSWG Company Overview Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) is a leading coffee and beverage company in North America with dual headquarters in Burlington, MA and Plano, TX, with annual revenue in excess of $11 billion. KDP holds leadership positions in soft drinks, specialty coffee and tea, water, juice and juice drinks and mixers, and markets the #1 single serve coffee brewing system in the U.S. The Company maintains an unrivaled distribution system that enables its portfolio of more than 125 owned, licensed and partner brands to be available nearly everywhere people shop and consume beverages. With a wide range of hot and cold beverages that meet virtually any consumer need, KDP key brands include Keurig®, Dr Pepper®, Green Mountain Coffee Roasters®, Canada Dry®, Snapple®, Bai®, Mott’s® and The Original Donut Shop®. The Company employs more than 25,000 employees and operates more than 120 offices, manufacturing plants, warehouses and distribution centers across North America. Benefits built for you: Our people are the heart of our business, which is why we offer robust benefits to support your health and wellness as well as your personal and financial well-being. We also provide employee programs designed to enhance your professional growth and development while ensuring you feel valued, inspired and appreciated at work. Job Overview Machine Operator I - $20.10 hourly - $1,000 sign on bonus (.35 shift differential for 2nd & 3rd shifts) The Machine Operator I is responsible for operating and monitoring production machinery to maximize production and maintain Keurig Dr Pepper's high standards in safety and quality. This role will also be engaged in supporting improvements to the manufacturing process in the areas of safety, quality, delivery, productivity and growth. Position Responsibilities: Maintain a safe and healthy environment, demonstrating safe behaviors at all times. Understand and help drive improvement to quality systems and policies (Quality Data System, Safe Quality Food, Good Manufacturing Practices and Hazard Analysis Critical Control Points). Learn to safely operate and monitor high-speed production equipment. Actively engage in resolving production line issues, executing and developing standard work, tracking production data, and participating in KDP’s lean daily management process. Actively learn and participate in formal problem-solving processes with team members. Generate productivity and continuous improvement ideas. Demonstrate KDP values of Team First, Deliver Big, Think Bold, Being Fearless and Fair. Qualifications: Ability to quickly learn about how processing and packaging equipment works. Mechanical understanding or manufacturing experience preferred. Self-motivated team player with ability to make decisions, communicate and problem solve. Comfort with basic computer functions and ability to quickly learn production software. Basic mathematical skills to make production calculations Requirements Ability to lift up to 35 pounds and 50 pounds occasionally. Ability to bend, stretch and stand during entire shift. Ability to frequently kneel, squat, climb stairs/ladders, bend, stoop, twist, and reach overhead with repetitive motions. Ability to work in a variety of temperature and humidity conditions. Job Overview Machine Operator II The Machine Operator is responsible for complete operation of assigned stations and all other associated work. Shift / Schedule: This position will work 2nd shift: 2:00pm - 10:30pm. Flexibility and availability to work overtime and holidays based on business needs. Compensation: This is a full-time position with a pay rate of $25.17/hr Benefits: Full Eligibility to our Benefits package. Position Responsibilities Makes independent adjustments to the filler-capper to maintain greatest operational efficiency including: properly reattach hoses, properly set filler speed, and properly adjust fill height. Assist mechanics while performing preventative maintenance and mechanical repairs as required. Actively work to optimize machine and overall line performance. Must be willing and able to do changeovers. Maintain adherence to the production schedule in an accurate and timely manner. Ensure productivity by adhering to corporate manufacturing practices, standard operating procedures, critical control points and safety practices. Ensure finished products meet quality specifications by accurately conducting online quality checks and sampling as follows: fill temperature checks, cold water vacuum checks, cap security and pull-ups, weight control, tap tone dud detector check, packaging material lot identification, removal torque tests and cap code checks. Manually records data through chart recording, and makes necessary process adjustments based on data findings. Clean and sanitize all equipment and facility as required. Identify potential problems and correct situation or notify supervisor. Job Overview Maintenance Coordinator The Maintenance Coordinator is responsible for processes and procedures for ordering, receiving, organizing, storing, and dispatching of plant materials and supplies. Ensure availability of necessary materials to support day to day operations of a large fast paced manufacturing facility. Shift and Schedule: This is a full time position working 1st shift, Monday through Friday, 7:00am - 4:00pm. Flexibility to work overtime, weekends, and holidays is required as scheduled. Compensation: The starting rate of pay for this position is $28.50 per hour. Benefits: KDP offers a very competitive benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, 401k, Beverage Benefit, & so much more! Benefits are available to new hires DAY 1! Responsibilities: Maintain and run reports for established metrics for the department visual management board. Manage the ordering process of all parts in Sap and non-SAP parts (consumable). Weekly review the requisition list in SAP driven by consumed parts. Identify proper vendor for the parts and contact the vendor for correct pricing. Create a PO for the needed parts and send to the vendor. Track all shipments. Receives incoming materials, to include visual inspection of the materials, verification of shipping documentation, placing item in appropriate storage area, and updating SAP. Appropriately addresses any issues during this process to include, A/P resolutions, researching paperwork, making necessary contacts. Collaboratively works with the Maintenance Technicians & Supervisors on non-stock items, including researching, competitive pricing, affirming timelines, ordering, receiving, and distribution to appropriate project. Maintains the Maintenance parts in SAP to include tracking, reporting monthly and maintaining, accurate inventory levels of parts and ERSA materials. Throughout the year performs physical inventories of parts and materials as determined by Finance. Generates purchase orders per management and technician request and determine the proper GL for the request. Track all cost for PO’s created and report out to management for budget requirements. Work closely with Finance. Follow the established process to add new parts to SAP working closely with Vendors and Master Data team. Coordinates with established preferred vendors to maintain the proper parts. This would include working closely with Grainger to help manage the vending machine and all other non-inventory items. Stage incoming parts from work orders for the completion of ongoing jobs. Any additional tasks as needed. Requirements What you must have: 2 years maintenance coordinating experience preferred SAP experience highly preferred Microsoft Excel experience highly preferred Ability to communicate technical information accurately and clearly Ability to uphold Safety standards, participate in Continuous Process Improvement on the job, and follow our Manufacturing best practices Ability to get along with others, be punctual, and follow instructions Associates degree in relevant field is preferred Proficiency in developing maintenance documentation and standards preferred Physical Requirements / Working Conditions: Ability to lift 75 pounds frequently with mechanical assistance Ability to lift 30 pounds on a regular basis and 50 pounds occasionally Ability to constantly lift, bend, stretch and stand during entire shift Ability to push/pull up to 1,500 pounds using supplied equipment Ability to frequently kneel, squat, bend, and stoop, twist, and reach overhead with repetitive motions Ability to work in a sedentary light office position with high frequency of keyboarding/computer work required (50% - 75% of the workday) Company Overview Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) is a leading coffee and beverage company in North America with dual headquarters in Burlington, MA and Plano, TX, with annual revenue in excess of $11 billion. Job Overview The Maintenance Mechanic I is responsible for troubleshooting, repairing, and maintaining a variety of mechanical and electrical manufacturing equipment, while meeting productivity requirements and maintaining KDP’s high standards in safety and quality. Shift & Schedule: 3rd shift Compensation: $28.13 plus .30 Shift Premium Maintain a safe and healthy environment, demonstrating safe behaviors Focus on Good Manufacturing and Food Safety practices in all work. Analyze mechanical, pneumatic, hydraulic or electrical problems and make repairs through adjustments, defective parts replacement, or fabrication. Wire moderately complex control circuits. Teach basic mechanical skills to line operators to support autonomous maintenance, TPM functions, equipment set-up and centerlining. Fabricate, repair, and install hangers and all types of piping including hot/cold water, steam, process and condensate, utilizing formulas for all phases. Ability to quickly learn to weld and machine metals, plastics, and composites. Fabricate or replicate minor pieces for the repair or replacement of parts on equipment. Complete size changeovers and troubleshoot liquid fillers and packaging equipment. Identify root causes of mechanical, electrical and control failures and resolve with effective problem-solving tools with minimal downtime or supervision. Troubleshoot and program minor changes in Allen Bradley PLC (SLC500, MicroLogix, CompactLogix and ControlLogix). Generate productivity and continuous improvement ideas. Demonstrate KDP values of Team First, Deliver Big, Think Bold, Being Fearless and Fair. Requirements 1+ year maintenance experience in a manufacturing environment or equivalent education Self-motivated team player with the ability and willingness to make decisions, effectively communicate, problem solve and teach others. Lift, push, and pull up to 50 pounds occasionally. Ability to frequently walk, kneel, squat, climb, bend, stoop, and twist. Ability to work in a variety of temperature and humidity conditions. Job Overview Electro Mechanical Technician - Lead The Electro Mechanic Technician performs project management duties, maintenance and repairs of all pneumatic machines and line equipment. Shift & Schedule: This is a full time position on 3rd shift working 10:00pm-6:30am, Monday-Friday. Flexibility to work overtime, weekends and holidays as scheduled is required. Compensation: Starting rate of pay is $40/hr. A shift differential will also be provided. Job Overview Merchandiser for Plano, Mckinney, and the surrounding area Hiring Immediately The Merchandiser is responsible for providing high-quality merchandising support for Keurig Dr Pepper brands like 7UP, Snapple, Core, Bai and other fan favorites to retail stores within the assigned territory. About The Role Merchandisers are responsible for stocking and displaying our products on shelves/coolers at large accounts within a set territory. They will report directly to their assigned stores for their scheduled shifts and may be required to cover routes as assigned. Merchandisers are required to use their personal vehicle to travel among stores in their territory; however, they are not responsible for transporting our products. Our products will be delivered in advance to the stores. A company-issued phone will be provided with a programed app to clock in and out for scheduled shifts and to track mileage for reimbursement. Shift and Schedule Full-time 5:00am until work is finished 5 scheduled shifts per week Weekends required (days off fall during the week) Flexibility to work overtime as needed Compensation And Benefits Pay starting at $17.25 per hour plus overtime rate after 40 hours Mileage reimbursement for the use of your personal vehicle Full benefits package available Day 1 Medical, dental, vision 401K with company match Paid weekly About You We are looking for a self-motivated and customer service-oriented individual who enjoys working in a fast-paced environment. You thrive working independently on assigned tasks, but you look forward to interacting with people at work. You prefer to stay active and are excited to spend the majority of your shift lifting, pushing, and pulling cases of our products. Taking pride in your work and being detailed-oriented are qualities that are important to you. Please apply now if you are the person we’re searching for to join KDP! About The Role Merchandisers are responsible for stocking and displaying our products on shelves/coolers at large accounts within a set territory. They will report directly to their assigned stores for their scheduled shifts and may be required to cover routes as assigned. Merchandisers are required to use their personal vehicle to travel among stores in their territory; however, they are not responsible for transporting our products. Our products will be delivered in advance to the stores. A company-issued phone will be provided with a programed app to clock in and out for scheduled shifts and to track mileage for reimbursement. Shift and Schedule Full-time 5:00am/6:00am am until work is finished 5 scheduled shifts per week Weekends required (days off fall during the week) Flexibility to work overtime as needed Compensation And Benefits Pay starting at $17.25 per hour plus overtime rate after 40 hours Mileage reimbursement for the use of your personal vehicle Full benefits package available Day 1 Medical, dental, vision 401K with company match Paid weekly About You We are looking for a self-motivated and customer service-oriented individual who enjoys working in a fast-paced environment. You thrive working independently on assigned tasks, but you look forward to interacting with people at work. You prefer to stay active and are excited to spend the majority of your shift lifting, pushing, and pulling cases of our products. Taking pride in your work and being detailed-oriented are qualities that are important to you. Please apply now if you are the person we’re searching for to join KDP! Requirements High school diploma or general equivalency diploma preferred (GED) Lift up to 50 lbs repeatedly Push and pull up to 100 lbs repeatedly Valid driver's license Consistent access to a reliable vehicle for daily use Company Overview Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) is a leading coffee and beverage company in North America with dual headquarters in Burlington, MA and Plano, TX, with annual revenue in excess of $11 billion. KDP holds leadership positions in soft drinks, specialty coffee and tea, water, juice and juice drinks and mixers, and markets the #1 single serve coffee brewing system in the U.S. The Company maintains an unrivaled distribution system that enables its portfolio of more than 125 owned, licensed and partner brands to be available nearly everywhere people shop and consume beverages. With a wide range of hot and cold beverages that meet virtually any consumer need, KDP key brands include Keurig®, Dr Pepper®, Green Mountain Coffee Roasters®, Canada Dry®, Snapple®, Bai®, Mott’s® and The Original Donut Shop®. The Company employs more than 25,000 employees and operates more than 120 offices, manufacturing plants, warehouses and distribution centers across North America. Job Overview Merchandising Manager - San Leandro, Petaluma, Castroville The Merchandising Manager is responsible for leading, training, and developing a team of Merchandising Supervisors, as well as supporting achievement of territory sales goals through the development of on/off shelf distribution. Will ensure execution of point-of-sale and pricing activities of Keurig Dr Pepper brands like 7UP, Snapple, Core, Bai and other fan favorites to retail stores within territory. Details This position will be supporting customer's stores in San Leandro, Petaluma, Castroville and surrounding areas.. Salaried position based on experience, bonus eligible, and benefits available on first day of employment including Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K and many more offerings Will directly manage a team of 5-6 direct reports; all Supervisory roles. This position will be working 5 consecutive days. Personal vehicle and auto insurance required; mileage reimbursement program for using your own vehicle to travel around the territory, as needed Responsibilities Foster an environment that promotes personal development of Merchandising Supervisors and their Merchandisers Ensure Merchandising staffing is at Annual Operating Plan (AOP) staffing targets Manage labor costs and Case Per Hour (CPH) targets in-line with AOP targets Ensure, schematic compliance; manage day-to-day performance of teams to include all performance metrics Drive company-wide product education initiatives to ensure members of all teams are well-versed in our present and future product offerings Monitor retail pricing off-shelf display to maintain correct staffing levels. Utilize appropriate merchandising and management techniques to maximize the company’s return on inventory investment and space in stores Develop and implement Merchandising strategies to enable Territory specific execution showcasing KDP brands Work with Grocery Managers, Account Management, Supervisors, Merchandisers, and Reset Specialists to strengthen market and vendor relationships Oversee Merchandiser routing for sales and deliveries to be cost-effective and maintain a high level of customer service. Job Overview As a Multisite Engineering Co-op at Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP), you will be part of an exciting and fast-paced company, whose goal is to satisfy every customer’s beverage need, anytime, anywhere! You will have real responsibilities and lead projects that contribute to the overall growth and success of this leading beverage company. With a wide range of both hot and cold beverage offerings, you will have the unique opportunity to learn about project planning and scheduling, budgeting, communication and organization with suppliers, testing, and building relationships. You will engage and partner on meaningful projects to gain experience in a high energy, cross functional team environment You will receive mentor support for your professional development You will network and learn about other functions at Keurig Dr Pepper through the Co-op program You will present a final presentation to your team, peers, and senior leaders to highlight your project work and impact on the business You will receive experience in manufacturing facilities to understand processes and build relationships What you may do: Co-Lead a capital engineering project located in an assigned manufacturing facility with an experienced Project Manager Work as part of the manufacturing facility and Multisite Engineering Partner with Project and Program managers to build and understand business cases for projects you are involved in Support in budgeting and scheduling for capital projects assigned Gain expertise in Microsoft Office and SAP Build relationships and gain communication skills with internal and external stakeholders Internally: Procurement, Legal, Demand Planning, Maintenance, Operations Externally: Construction Firms, Equipment Suppliers, Integrators Be involved in some of or all of the following phases of a capital project: Initiate projects using a project charter and Stage Gate documents based on planned AOP (Annual Operating Plan) projects Plan and research designs Execute Monitor and control Close Balance work priorities to meet the day-to-day requirements of the Plant business teams. Provide support and coordinate events for a variety of facility programs Follow all Keurig Dr Pepper policies and procedures As a co-op at Keurig Dr Pepper, you may: Participate in networking sessions with KDP executives and other organization leaders Receive professional development training such as networking, resume building, presenting, and interviewing Be paired with a mentor to enhance your knowledge of other parts of the business and build your network Complete a project from start to finish and present it and your takeaways to your team, department vice president and other KDP stakeholders Requirements Be an undergraduate student currently enrolled in a full-time academic program (Engineering discipline) Be available to work full time (40 hours per week, M-F, 8am-5pm) from June 2023 to August 2023. There is potential to work off typical schedule due to project needs. Be in strong academic standing Motivation to learn new skills, with passion for engineering and the drive to obtain results Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail with demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects, prioritize requests, and meet deadlines Effective communication skills including listening, written, and verbal Work visa sponsorship is not available for this position, including CPT/OPT. This is an onsite role based in one of our manufacturing facilities and/or one of our two corporate headquarters. The pay rate for this position is $27/hour. Job Overview Paid Marketing Specialist Blend consumer connection with the fast-paced, goal-focused atmosphere of a top consumer goods company! Keurig is looking for a Paid Marketing Specialist: an early career marketer passionate about performance marketing, specifically for paid search and shopping campaigns. The Paid Marketing Specialist will work across the DTC and B2B teams, with the goal of driving online conversion for subscription, coffee makers and K-Cup pods. The position reports the Sr. Manager, Paid Marketing and partners closely with our cross-functional marketing, merchandising, and product teams. Responsibilities: Manage paid search and shopping campaigns on Google Ads and Microsoft Ads; ensuring campaigns are set up with best practices and routinely optimized for maximum efficiency Responsible for the day-to-day campaign management including budget and bids adjustment, campaign optimization and expansion Analyze performance data and provide weekly, monthly, quarterly performance reviews and provide insights for campaign, bid optimization, audience targeting and promotions Conduct keyword research; ensure ad copy is created and implemented according to best practices Implement A/B tests, participate in betas, report out results, and develop recommendations for roll-out Analyze market trends and competitor behavior to inform strategy Cultivate close relationships with platform teams at Google and Microsoft to optimize performance and stay educated on new opportunities Requirements 1+ years of relevant hands-on experience executing and optimizing paid campaigns across Google Ads and/or Microsoft Ads Excellent analytical and critical thinking skills, able to derive actionable insights from data Good communication skills, both verbal and written Proven ability to work cross-functionally with key stakeholders Must be detail-oriented, able to pivot, and work well under pressure A degree in marketing, business, analytics, or an equivalent combination of education, training, and experience related field. Proficient in Excel, PowerPoint, Google Analytics. Job Overview Part-Time Merchandiser for Greater Duluth, MN & Superior, WI Hiring Immediately The Merchandiser is responsible for providing high-quality merchandising support for Keurig Dr Pepper brands to retail stores within the assigned territory. About The Role Merchandisers are responsible for stocking and displaying our products on shelves/coolers at large accounts within a set territory. They will report directly to their assigned stores for their scheduled shifts and may be required to cover routes as assigned. Merchandisers are required to use their personal vehicle to travel among stores in their territory; however, they are not responsible for transporting our products. Our products will be delivered in advance to the stores. A company-issued phone will be provided with a programed app to clock in and out for scheduled shifts and to track mileage for reimbursement. Shift and Schedule Part-Time 6:30 am until work is finished 3-4 scheduled shifts per week Weekends required (days off fall during the week) Compensation And Benefits Pay starting at $16.92 per hour Mileage reimbursement for the use of your personal vehicle Paid weekly About You We are looking for a self-motivated and customer service-oriented individual who enjoys working in a fast-paced environment. You thrive working independently on assigned tasks, but you look forward to interacting with people at work. You prefer to stay active and are excited to spend the majority of your shift lifting, pushing, and pulling cases of our products. Taking pride in your work and being detailed-oriented are qualities that are important to you. Please apply now if you are the person we’re searching for to join KDP! Hand stack cases of product weighing up to 50 pounds repetitively from floor to over-head. Place the beverage products in a defined stacking pattern onto the pallet. Ability to hand shrink wrap pallets of completed orders. Ability to work in multi-temperature environments, hot or cool. Job Overview A senior technical Innovation role creating and developing new Packaging Concepts, Prototypes, and Structures with focus on delivering Sustainable Packaging Material Propositions. The role is part of the Coffee Pod Packaging Innovation & R&D team focused on designing and developing disruptive packaging innovation; delivering package innovations and driving the development and execution of new and refreshed package formats across a range of package materials and structures (cups, lids, filters, films, paperboard) used in line with our coffee beverage business unit to deliver on our brand innovation growth ambitions. The Principal Packaging Innovator will: Develop and commercialize differentiated new packages with the Coffee business and deliver in a method to support the values of unrivaled quality, creativity and innovation across core brands, existing pipeline, and new Innovation Platforms. Work with incumbent and new material packaging vendors to identify novel materials & packaging technologies that can deliver company objectives and multi-year brand pipelines. Collaborate with Brand, Procurement, & Supply Chain, to design consumer-centric packaging for the first and second moment of truth, while optimizing for manufacturing and distribution. Advance the business through technical excellence ensuring all aspects meet or exceed the quality and performance requirements within a managed timeline and cost objective. Be tightly connected and a key contributor to the broader Coffee Innovation, R&D Product and Process Development and Supply Chain Functions Be a key technical developer delivering our Sustainable Packaging Ambitions on Ready to Recycle, Compostable, and PCR content. Responsibilities of this role include the following: Initiate and perform technical feasibility studies on new packaging platforms delivered through ideation Cross-Functional Project Leadership Actively participate in Marketing and Marketing Research programs, including focus groups and other consumer research formats to inform Packaging design and structures Strong communication, organizational, and collaboration skills; Ability to influence cross functional teams, suppliers across multiple sites Strong collaboration skills; ability to bring together people from different sectors and business units to ensure the requirements reflect the global needs Ability to manage multiple competing priorities without impacting timelines Ability to prioritize risk and quickly identify issue resolution options, pros, cons, and action plan Contribute to Research & insights Teams to incorporate packaging requirements into plans Provide Subject Matter Expertise for Package Development and Commercialization Define, maintain, and update packaging specifications and protocols to assure robust manufacturing and consistent consumer experiences with our brands. Requirements BS in Packaging, Chemical, Mechanical, Plastics Engineering or equivalent with 8+ years’ experience in related consumer goods field. MS or PhD a plus Experience working with Consumer-Packaged Goods (CPG) with food/beverage Expertise in thermoformed and injection molded cups; polymer based, aluminum, laminated flexibles; wet and dry-molded fiber; paperboard; bio based resins a plus Strong understanding of circular economy, recyclability, compostability and reusability of packaging Strong track record of championing innovation and sustainable packaging within organizations and Successful executed programs from idea to implementation, completing the research case to drive the change. Adept understanding of consumer informed research, design, analytical and physical testing methodologies Strong commercial acumen, technical development skills, judgment and understanding of the business and industry. A mix of career experience across R&D, Quality, B2B, and Design a plus Change readiness, resiliency, and flexibility to thrive in a constantly-changing and fast-moving work environment Company Overview Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) is a leading coffee and beverage company in North America with dual headquarters in Burlington, MA and Plano, TX, with annual revenue in excess of $11 billion. Job Overview As a modern beverage company, Keurig Dr. Pepper (NASDAQ: KDP) was the first to bring hot and cold beverages together at scale. We are building on our position as the innovation leader in appliances to deliver the next generation of Keurig® machines to brew the love for our consumers and customers. Our Keurig® appliances implement advanced technology to bring our consumers a consistently perfect cup and we’re on a journey to engineer an even better cup of coffee while bringing our consumers the most simple and exceptional beverage experience yet. As part of our Appliance Global Product Organization, you will be at the heart of a team that is transforming our iconic brand for the next era. Keurig Brewers utilize advanced technology to provide the Perfect Cup, in every cup. This product development team is responsible for end-to-end research, design, manufacture, and delivery of all beverage appliances for the At Home and Away from Home market segments. We expect all of our employees to exemplify our strong company values of “Team First”, “Deliver Big”, “Think Bold” and “Be Fearless and Fair” in their daily work. To support you on your journey, our facilities provide state-of-the-art technology, equipment, and workspaces. We also offer a competitive benefits package, training, and mentoring by our executive team. The Keurig Appliances team is engineering a better cup of coffee. The team is the heart of an initiative transforming the iconic brand for the next era. Working in a fast-paced and highly collaborative environment, the Product Engineer II will be involved in all phases of Keurig Appliance development with an emphasis on helping the team define the best-in-class beverage delivery performance of our products. We need to both understand where we can improve versus our competition and create a vision of the future that will help us chart a path beyond what we imagine is possible today. In addition to the Performance attribute, you will help support the delivery of best-in-class delivery in other important product attributes such as Craftsmanship, Ease of Use and Aesthetics. These are some of the characteristics that help in this type of work: Endless Curiosity: We cannot be satisfied with the status quo. We want to know more about our consumers and their perceptions as well as more about our products and our competitors. Bias Towards Action: Work to understand what data is needed, systematically plan, roll up our sleeves, and act on data driven recommendations. This may mean we may need to tear down products, build prototypes, and run some tests to get the answers we’re looking for. Comfort with Ambiguity: Everyone who works on Keurig appliances is jointly responsible for developing leading products. To succeed, we need to go beyond only uncovering an idea or insight. We need to take the next step to develop insights and search out people who can help us build knowledge and impact change. This is a hybrid position within our Global Product Organization based out of our Chicago, IL office or our Burlington, MA office. This role will follow a working model of three days in the office, two days working remotely. Your Responsibilities And Deliverables Will Include Support attribute focused projects through our advanced development process to build reusable knowledge for downstream development processes Reference existing research and synthesize analysis from it Build physical prototypes or theoretical models that are used to understand trade spaces Design and conduct experiments Partner with internal or external resources to conduct consumer research Design and support performance benchmarking of Keurig and competitive products Determine key performance characteristics for competitive products Measure, develop and provide key insights to attribute leader and project teams Contribute to target setting activities on both advanced development and development projects Refine and improve analysis approach in partnership with attribute leader and the advanced development team Support continuous improvement activities across multiple product attributes Multiple opportunities, some examples below Requirements library refinement Correlation of our consumer feedback to the performance of our products and developing refined views of priorities Partner with other team members to develop new measurement methods or models Work with various product attribute leaders and subsystem teams on requirements decomposition for product attributes Support attribute leaders and other key stakeholders to develop and maintain long term strategy for our key product attributes Some occasional domestic travel with international travel opportunities Requirements Bachelor’s degree in relevant field 2+ years of relevant experience Preferred Experiences And Skills Master’s degree in relevant field Prior experience with LabVIEW Familiarity with modeling/simulation techniques or tools Modelica / Dymola, Matlab Simulink, CFD, FEA, or other physics-based modeling Six Sigma Green Belt or Black Belt New product development process experience Experience “speaking” the languages of consumer insights, marketing, engineering, design, and analytics and Experience in quantifying the relationship between consumer perception and product attributes. Job Overview At Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) the consumer is at the heart of everything we do. Join the team at KDP and make a difference to consumers with one of America’s leading producers and distributors of hot and cold beverages helping to satisfy every consumer’s beverage need, anytime and anywhere. We are looking for a Program Manager to oversee multiple projects ranging from high complexity with considerable resource and functional integration to medium complexity projects with fewer resources and risk. Programs are more strategic in nature and focus on longer term business objectives. Scope of projects include new product, business integration, and/or new supply chains. Role is based in Burlington, MA Relocation Assistance is Available*** What you will do: Drive program execution from advanced development through product launch while closely monitoring product performance, cost and quality. Develop program plans and schedules, assemble project teams, assign individual responsibilities, identify appropriate resources needed, and ensure timely completion of projects. Communicate and coordinate with senior leadership, external suppliers/vendors, functional area leaders and stakeholders regarding all aspects of projects being managed. Represent organization as a prime contact on projects. Lead cross-functional teams in development of solutions to a variety of complex problems using business acumen, technical, and interpersonal skills. Identify roadblocks and risks and recommend resolution. Identify and resolve conflict, manage interdependencies and resolve issues quickly. Ensure solutions are consistent with organization objectives and strategy. Develop, maintain and manage project stakeholders and appropriate communication, engagement and support. Supervisory Responsibilities: No direct reports – potential to mentor more junior members of Program Management Office Requirements Characteristics for Success: Experience launching products working alongside cross-functional teams. Project management professional certification preferred. Demonstrated influence/communication skills (verbal, written, presentation) with various levels in organization. Strong planning and organizational skills. Strong communication skills and ability to influence internal and external stakeholders. Demonstrated time management skills while delivering multiple objectives. Demonstrated business analysis skills. Ability to deal with ambiguity and changing priorities. Ability to get along with others, be punctual, and follow instructions. Ability to follow Keurig Policies and Procedures as well as our Operating Principles. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in engineering or business management field 7+ years’ experience in project management or comparable experience. Experience with Smartsheet or equivalent project management tools Experience managing multi-million-dollar capital, expense or commercialization projects Experience with MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, Visio) Experience with SAP or similar ERP system Experience with Agile Project Management, Rapid Learning Cycles, or similar Project Management Methodologies #IND-1 Company Overview Keurig Dr Pepper (NYSE: KDP) is a leading coffee and beverage company in North America, with annual revenue in excess of $11 billion. Formed in 2018 with the merger of Keurig Green Mountain and Dr Pepper Snapple Group, we have leadership positions in soft drinks, specialty coffee and tea, water, juice and juice drinks and mixers, and we market the #1 single serve coffee brewing system in the U.S. We have an unrivaled distribution system that enables our portfolio of more than 125 owned, licensed and partner brands to be available nearly everywhere people shop and consume beverages. With a wide range of hot and cold beverages that meet virtually any consumer need, KDP key brands include Keurig®, Dr Pepper®, Green Mountain Coffee Roasters®, Canada Dry®, Snapple®, Bai®, Mott’s® and The Original Donut Shop®. We have more than 25,000 employees and more than 120 offices, manufacturing plants, warehouses and distribution centers across North America. Job Overview Quality Assurance Technician The Quality Assurance Technician is responsible for performing standardized qualitative and quantitative tests on work-in-process and finished products to ensure compliance with company and/or customer quality standards. Shift & Schedule: This is a full time position on the night shift working 6:00pm to 6:00am on a 223 schedule. Flexibility to work overtime, weekends and holidays as scheduled is required. Compensation: Starting rate of pay is $24.96/hr. Shift differential is also available. Benefits: KDP offers a very competitive benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, 401k, Beverage Benefit, & so much more! Benefits are available to new hires DAY 1! Perform laboratory testing procedures on raw ingredients and finished products to ensure they meet established company specifications. Conduct QA audits throughout the production plant and have basic knowledge of production lines. Record results of audits and inspections on reports and computer programs. Calibrate and operate (following training): Refractometer PH meter Auto Titrator Density meter Spectrophotometer Understand CIP / product run rule processes. Understand protocols for vendor holds and finished product holds. Cleaning labs and testing equipment. Knowledge of packaging materials including caps, labels, PET bottles, glass, etc. Gather, record, and store finished product retained samples. Submit samples for in-house microbiological testing. Eagerly approach all new functions with a team-oriented attitude. Assist with support on QA projects. Other duties as assigned by the manager, supervisor, and lead. Requirements QUALIFICATIONS: High school diploma or general equivalency diploma (GED) required. BS or AA degree in any science or technical field preferred. 1-3 years of related QA experience in a manufacturing environment. Strong math and computer skills (Word, Excel, etc.). Strong written and verbal communication skills. PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS: Capable of standing/walking for long periods of time throughout the facility. Capable of climbing stairs. Capable of lifting to 50 lbs. Capable of operating a computer and testing equipment. Gather, lift, and transport items to the labs. With a wide range of hot and cold beverages that meet virtually any consumer need, KDP key brands include Keurig®, Dr Pepper®, Green Mountain Coffee Roasters®, Canada Dry®, Snapple®, Bai®, Mott’s® and The Original Donut Shop®. Job Overview As the Quality Supervisor you will supervise and provide day to day leadership to a team of Quality Technicians to ensure Quality plans are met. The Quality Supervisor will be involved in designing experiments for product, packaging and line qualifications, analyzing and solving quality problems, preparing procedures, and training inspectors. You will perform audits, analyze quality costs and other quality data, and apply quality tools and fundamental statistical methods for process control to ensure production of products and processes are consistent with established standards. You will promote and support Keurig Dr Pepper’s Continuous Improvement efforts and initiatives. Shift & Schedule: This position will support our B Shift, with hours from 6:00pm - 6:00am on a Sunday - Tuesday, alt. Wednesdays schedule. Flexibility for additional coverage outside of these hours, including potential weekends and/or holidays, is also required. Compensation: This is a full-time, exempt, and salaried position paid bi-weekly. Salary is flexible and determined by candidate's experience level. Benefits: KDP offers a very competitive benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, 401k, Beverage Benefit, & so much more! Benefits are available to new hires DAY 1! What you will do: Provide leadership and direction to QA Techs by managing the workload, training and employee relations issues. Ensure quality and food safety initiatives to link product development, manufacturing, process improvement with customer expectations are maintained. Ensure plant is “inspection ready” in compliance with requirements in preparation for third party, partner, regulatory, and certification audits. Manages the collection, analysis and reporting of performance and product conformance quality data to inform production department managers on status and priorities of quality issues. Support training of Quality Teams and Plant personnel in their QC process to ensure the proper performance to Keurig Dr Pepper Quality testing procedures, Quality policies and compliance with KDRP and customer specifications (i.e., Quality Manual). Perform audits and Quality tests with operations and QA staff to address quality related issues. Audit production processes to record, document, and evaluate consistency to customer and Keurig Dr Pepper specifications and validation of corrective actions over time. Develop and maintain quality information records and reports (customer complaints, internal issues, etc) to adequately communicate production capabilities and quality issue priorities and status, with regular reporting. Problem solve, troubleshoot and resolve quality issues – utilizing quality tools (cause and effect, process mapping, statistical methods, etc) with the ultimate goal being implementation of effective corrective actions. Monitor production QC performance to ensure that labeling, product information and product packaging satisfies Keurig Dr Pepper and/or customer specifications. Helps facilitate dispositions/resolutions to daily production quality issues as needed. Use and maintain quality databases (design, create, import, export, query, report, analyze) Ensure the staff is aware of their responsibility to report food safety, quality and regulatory compliance with authority to initiate action Responsible for ensuring the production of a safe, wholesome and quality product and requires trained designees when applicable. Assists in hiring and training of new employees Performs other duties as requested by management. Follow all Keurig Dr Pepper policies and procedures. Requirements What you must have: Bachelor of Science degree in Food Science, Engineering, Chemistry, Biology, or related field highly preferred 3-5 years experience in a product development or quality role, preferably in food manufacturing Demonstrated expertise in building Quality Plans including strategy and tactics that have successfully met Quality/Food Safety KPI’s and Quality Goals Working knowledge of all Microsoft Office applications Advanced understanding of GMP, HACCP, FSMA, Safe Quality Food (SQF) Principles, Food Defense Principles & Quality Management Systems. (QMS) Previous experience using SAP and SPC (InfinityQS) is preferred. Lead execution of a strong CAPA (Corrective Action / Preventative Action) program and A3’s that drives site improvement in Quality and Regulatory Compliance. Excellent written and verbal communication skills across a broad variety of departments Ability to positively and comfortably handle and prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment with self-motivation and focused attention to detail. Ability and experience to lead and manage 10-15 employees Must be able to travel occasionally, work in a team environment, and occasionally work a flexible schedule. Ability to work a flexible schedule, various shifts as needed Ability to develop protocols, training materials and reports with the guidance of resources Self starter; take charge, positive and proactive attitude Company Overview Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) is a leading coffee and beverage company in North America with dual headquarters in Burlington, MA and Plano, TX, with annual revenue in excess of $11 billion. KDP holds leadership positions in soft drinks, specialty coffee and tea, water, juice and juice drinks and mixers, and markets the #1 single serve coffee brewing system in the U.S. The Company maintains an unrivaled distribution system that enables its portfolio of more than 125 owned, licensed and partner brands to be available nearly everywhere people shop and consume beverages. With a wide range of hot and cold beverages that meet virtually any consumer need, KDP key brands include Keurig®, Dr Pepper®, Green Mountain Coffee Roasters®, Canada Dry®, Snapple®, Bai®, Mott’s® and The Original Donut Shop®. The Company employs more than 25,000 employees and operates more than 120 offices, manufacturing plants, warehouses and distribution centers across North America. Benefits built for you: Our people are the heart of our business, which is why we offer robust benefits to support your health and wellness as well as your personal and financial well-being. We also provide employee programs designed to enhance your professional growth and development while ensuring you feel valued, inspired and appreciated at work. Job Overview Job Description The Regional Sales Manager (RSM) CALA will have the management responsibilities for KDP International Business in the Caribbean and Latin America Region. Key areas of focus include sales operations and distributor management, executing annual operating and marketing plans, forecasting, business development, A&P budget management, KPI Management and leadership Location: Southern Florida (Miami, Fort Lauderdale, or Boca Raton) Travel Approx 50% Job Responsibilities Lead contact for KDP/MSI distributors partners in the CALA Region Distributor management experience with an entrepreneurial spirit, solution-oriented, strategic mindset, strong analytical, and financial acumen. Field-based leadership: outstanding sales experience and track record in the Consumer Goods industry (Beverage Preferred). Lead and develop annual Joint Business Planning with local distributors, aligning on priorities, setting strategic objectives, and track performance. Meet regional sales and financial objectives by securing shipments, distribution, shelf space, local programming, and new launches. Track performance and implement corrective actions as needed. Monitor sales progress against AOP objectives, coaching local team and distributors to execute with excellence. Experience displaying dynamic leadership skills to manage and motivate distributors and partners Work collaboratively with marketing and finance to drive/lead annual operating plan. Manage Trade/Marketing coop funds to drive annual operating plan execution. Ensure receivables. Lead CALA forecast process (volume and revenue) and manage an accuracy KPI Leverage syndicated and retail customer data to discuss the state of the business, consumer trends, key business drivers, and discover incremental opportunities. Clear and proven ability to develop and implement successful sales and marketing tactics and strategies. Excellent communication skills, including presentation and training ability A Successful Candidate Will Have The Following A strong understanding of relevant International business markets preferably in beverage segment Superior negotiation skills Strong strategic thought process Outstanding account management track record substantiated by sales successes Experience/Familiarity with CSD bottling systems Proven analytical experience and strength with numbers. Action-orientated self-starter Excellent oral and written communication skills. Financial acumen, and pricing strategy Requirements Requirements Bachelor's Degree 5+ years CPG industry experience in a sales capacity 5 continuous years working on FMCG in an international capacity Bilingual in Spanish is required Company Overview Company Overview & EEO Statement Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) is a leading coffee and beverage company in North America with dual headquarters in Burlington, MA and Plano, TX, with annual revenue in excess of $11 billion. KDP holds leadership positions in soft drinks, specialty coffee and tea, water, juice and juice drinks and mixers, and markets the #1 single serve coffee brewing system in the U.S. The Company maintains an unrivaled distribution system that enables its portfolio of more than 125 owned, licensed and partner brands to be available nearly everywhere people shop and consume beverages. With a wide range of hot and cold beverages that meet virtually any consumer need, KDP key brands include Keurig®, Dr Pepper®, Green Mountain Coffee Roasters®, Canada Dry®, Snapple®, Bai®, Mott’s® and The Original Donut Shop®. The Company employs more than 25,000 employees and operates more than 120 offices, manufacturing plants, warehouses and distribution centers across North America. Job Overview Relief Sales Manager for Norfolk and Columbus, NE The Relief Account Manager is responsible for up-selling and fulfillment/replenishment, focusing on execution and merchandising. This person will be accountable for retention and penetration of large format customers by geography and handling on-premise customers. Supporting Keurig Dr Pepper brands like 7UP, Snapple, Core, Bai and other fan favorites to retail stores within the assigned territory. Shift and Schedule Full-time 7:00 am until work is finished Monday through Friday Occasional weekends depending on business needs Flexibility to work overtime as needed is required Compensation And Benefits $18.00 per hour plus overtime after 40 hours Mileage reimbursement for the use of your personal vehicle Full benefits package available Day 1 Medical, dental, vision 401K with company match Paid weekly Position Responsibilities Sell Keurig Dr Pepper brands to maximize growth, share growth, distribution, and to obtain specific volume objectives by providing a seamless experience to customers in the absence of an Account Manager. Contact key personnel in assigned accounts pre-selling products, promotions, displays, point-of sale material, beverage section revamps, and service requirements. Develop and implement beverage shelf re-allocations designed to maximize the sales of Keurig Dr Pepper brands. Participate in the installation of revamped beverage sections, displays and placement of point of sale material according to company merchandising standards. Stock and merchandise Keurig Dr Pepper brands in the allocated beverage section, including racks and secondary displays. Assist in the sale, placement, and changing of vendors in chain store accounts; check regularly for proper mechanical operation, cleanliness, selection and product availability. Maintain accurate sales records for all assigned accounts, including special reports on promotional activity, competitive sales and space allocations. Maintain adequate amounts of back stock in each account to ensure product availability for in-store stocking and merchandising. Requirements 1 year of customer service experience in a retail environment or in a sales position being held accountable for sales targets/upselling Lift, push, and pull a minimum of 50 pounds repeatedly Valid driver’s license Company Overview Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) is a leading coffee and beverage company in North America with dual headquarters in Burlington, MA and Plano, TX, with annual revenue in excess of $11 billion. Render Production Artist Liquid Sunshine is the full-service, in-house creative marketing agency for Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) and its 125 leading beverage brands, including Dr Pepper, Snapple, Keurig, Green Mountain Coffee Roasters, 7UP, Bai, A&W, Core, Canada Dry, and Schweppes. Our mission is to help grow KDP’s iconic and refreshing brands with equally iconic and refreshing creative communications and experiences. We are seeking a proven Production Artist to help lead Liquid Sunshine through an exciting new phase of growth in capabilities, brand assignments, and creative excellence. The position reports into the Lead Production Artist for KDP and is based in the Burlington, MA. area. If you’re an ambitious, high energy, confident, and inspiring leader who thrives in a fast-paced creative environment, read on… WHAT YOU’LL DO: - Collaborate with Associate Production Director, Print Producers and Project Managers to deliver expectations and requirements for e-commerce, digital shelf and renders associate with such digital requests. - Heavy emphasis on execution of digital asset needs, across all e-commerce channels. Built to established specifications, including creation of various view of 2 and 3-dimensional illustrations of product images, (ADA compliant), mobile optimized version w/text, banner ad, bullet point and description copy for each asset. - Compose raster and vector artwork; retouch and recreate existing artwork as needed - Build digital and print-ready mechanical files using data inputs, and direction provided, including but not limited to naming conventions/file folder structure, server usage, etc. - Provide artwork for review of accuracy and printability and ensure project meets requirements to produce - Maintain or develop consistency across printed material elements or SKUs - Analyze and evaluate projects to determine most efficient execution - Revise artwork per guidance or direction - Flight Check/collect files for output when project is completed - Back up/archive final artwork per guidance provided Requirements WHAT YOU’LL BRING TO THE TABLE: - Requires a minimum of 3-5 years of industry experience in render creation, print production, graphic arts and/or related field. - 3 years technical expertise and knowledge of print and production capabilities and guidelines across a wide range of materials and outputs necessary. Advanced knowledge of image formats, file compression, and optimization techniques. - Bachelor of Art degree in Graphic design or equivalent. - Requires expert skills in Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop and InDesign at a minimum. Other Creative Cloud/Adobe Suite programs a bonus. - Skilled problem solver, detail oriented, highly organized with the ability to manage multiple projects with minimal supervision. - The optimism to think bigger, the curiosity to dig deeper, and the passion to do better. - The gravitas, emotional intelligence, and intellectual firepower to persuade senior stakeholders to embrace innovative, highly engaging, and sometimes risky work. - The conviction and willingness to fight for groundbreaking ideas when persuasion fails. - An entrepreneurial spirit, a strong work ethic, and a bold approach to problem-solving. - Determination, courage, and ingenuity in the face of obstacles, deadlines, ambiguity, and healthy conflict. - An infatuation with beverages, a love of brands, and a lifelong affair with all things creative. - Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Job Overview As the Sales Coordinator, you are a critical part of the team and will provide comprehensive, reliable, high quality sales support to our National Retail Sales (NRS) team. You will be responsible for facilitating team meetings and conference calls, completing and maintaining sales and trade data and customer profiles, and completing all administrative and paper work requirements involved with setting up a new customer or adding a current SKU to the customer’s product portfolio. You will also prepare responses to requests for quotations, coordinate inquiries regarding order status, ship date, price quotes, availability, and related questions. You will prepare basic sales reports and recaps of shipments, bookings, backlogs, and related activities, and will work to resolve other related items as needed. This is a hybrid position: 2 days remote, 3 days in office. What you will do: Maintain promotional database by inputting invoice and bill-back data. Own customer new item set-up for existing products. Update managers by consolidating, analyzing, and forwarding daily action summaries. Support Sales team to resolve order and inventory problems by: investigating data and history; identifying alternate means for filling orders; notifying managers and customers. Support Sales team to resolve promotional allowance, rebate, and pricing discrepancies by researching promotion details and regular and special prices, and forwarding resolution to managers. Provide product, promotion and pricing information by clarifying customer requests; selecting appropriate information; forwarding information; answering questions. Provide sales vs. projection results by preparing and forwarding sales tracking reports. Analyze data and identify meaningful business trends from the data. Maintain customer database by inputting customer profile and updates and preparing and distributing monthly reports. Maintain internal systems as appropriate by inputting customer data, pricing, volume, and/or trade spend. Support the preparation of sales presentations by compiling data and developing presentation formats and materials. Includes developing templates, graphics, and chart inputs at highest professional standards. Track, consolidate, analyze and summarize sales expenses and forward for reimbursement. Complete other sales support duties as needed. Communicate effectively to internal team members and external customers. Requirements Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Business or related field or a high school diploma and at least 5 years of experience in similar job scope/responsibilities Proficiency in MS Office Suite a must (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook) with database experience (Siebel or CRM systems) a plus Ability to manage multiple tasks and to develop efficient and effective “go to market” processes. Effective at shifting priorities as business needs require Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Company Overview Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) is a leading coffee and beverage company in North America with dual headquarters in Burlington, MA and Frisco, TX, with annual revenue in excess of $11 billion. With a wide range of hot and cold beverages that meet virtually any consumer need, KDP key brands include Keurig®, Dr Pepper®, Green Mountain Coffee Roasters®, Canada Dry®, Snapple®, Bai®, Mott’s® and The Original Donut Shop®. Job Overview Inside Sales Representative (Customer Sales and Service) - Columbus, OH The Customer Sales and Service Representative serves as the front line to our external Customer base. The primary responsibility will be to provide professional, timely and complete sales service to an assigned Customer base. The Customer Sales and Service Representative will provide Customer specific sales building solutions by leveraging Customer Relations Management (CRM) insights, creating rapport, and effectively translating product features into benefits. The Customer Sales and Service Representative should have a strong desire to serve. They are expected to educate, delight, and retain Customers. Effective Customer Sales and Service Representatives will have a high sales aptitude with strong organization and follow up skills. Additionally, the Telesales Representative should be a skilled communicator with the ability to unlock and understand business needs of retail Customers, translate product features into benefits, overcome selling objections, and provide resolution to Customer inquiries and issues. Position Shift and Schedule This is a full time position working 7am to 4pm, Monday through Friday. Flexibility to work overtime is needed as scheduled. Position Compensation The starting rate of pay for this position is $17.00 per hour + variable pay and an incentive plan. Attractive benefits package (medical, dental, vision, etc). Disclosure * After completing proper training the person in this position will be able to work under a hybrid mode, 3 days working from office + 2 days working from home. Position Responsibilities Plan and execute scheduled outbound telephone sales calls according to KDP processes and standards for an assigned Customer base. Monitor and evaluate assigned Customer call frequencies versus order rates and suggest adjustments to Supervisor when appropriate. Receive inbound telephone calls, email, ecommerce, and fax sales orders. Provide Customers with post order confirmation and follow up. Use historical sales data to create quality re-orders. Upsell, present, and sell new items as part of each outbound or inbound Customer sales interaction. Create and maintain rapport and relationships with assigned Customers. Collect and record Customer Relationship Management (CRM) data. Leverage CRM insights and sales history to enhance Customer rapport and to provide account specific sales solutions. Execute sales programs and initiatives, and achieve assigned sales goals. Stay informed on KDP product facts and features. Be able to effectively translate product features into benefits and sales solutions for assigned Customers. Monitor and report lack of sales activity or other unusual Customer sales trends. Evaluate Customers’ Cold Drink Equipment (CDE) compliance and work with Customer on resolution when issues exist. Report issues to Supervisor. Perform efficient and accurate sales order entry. Ensure the accuracy of pricing and Customer Master Data. Provide other, non-selling Customer Service support including: responding to CDE service issues when raised during the sales call, receiving and transferring external Customer Service calls, and providing order delivery feedback when requested. Coordinate sales service with field based Business Development Representatives. Requirements 1 year Customer Service, Sales, or Call Center experience in an office environment required Microsoft Office experience with advanced functions of Outlook and Excel required Prior experience with Margin Minder, SAP, or similar data collection/tracking systems preferred Previous call Center experience desire. Able to navigate through programs on the computer while multitasking with the phone. Job Overview Scientist, Beverage R&D – Frisco, TX The Scientist position will support the Productivity & Continuous Improvement team. This position will support all cold beverage brands on value optimization. The role will be to execute projects from ideation through commercialization while working with a cross functional team. Responsibilities: Working closely with Procurement and Finance to identify ways drive out ingredient cost, and value in Conduct bench-top experiments, formula calculations, and develop prototypes for product tastings and sensory testing Verify formula accuracy, complete formula documentation, and conduct pilot-plant trials Maintain accurate and detailed record of laboratory work Interpret test results, write technical reports, and effectively communicate information within the organization Use formulation software to document lab work and formulas Understand the R&D and project management process Work effectively with various functions of R&D (Sensory, Ingredients, Nutrition, Regulatory, Flavor Technology, Chemistry, Process Engineering, and Technical Services) Manage projects by leading cross-functional groups consisting of members across various departments of KDP Manage & document project savings using project management software Demonstrate flexibility in adapting to changing business needs and priorities Multi-task to achieve desired results Our offer: Our people are the heart of our business, which is why we offer robust benefits to support your health and wellness as well as your personal and financial well-being. The breadth and depth of our family of brands makes it possible for us to offer a variety of dynamic and exciting career opportunities. We provide employee programs designed to enhance your professional growth and development, while ensuring you feel valued, inspired and appreciated at work. Job Overview This position assists with the administration of US health and welfare and retirement programs. This position requires a high degree of organization and internal and external collaboration. The Benefit Analyst works closely with the members of the Labor Relations Team to assist with the development of recommendations for our union benefit programs. This position also assists with the open enrollment processes and works closely with HR Business Partners and HR Shared Services on escalated employee benefit matters. This position is based at our Frisco,TX location and will have a hybrid schedule (3 days remote/2 days in office) Key Duties And Responsibilities Propose benefit strategy with cost analysis comparisons, requiring an understanding of both retirement and health and welfare plan design. Must be able to review and understand the Collective Bargaining Agreements. Research and analyze benefit offerings. Create union benefit analysis presentations by working with Labor Relations, Benefit Broker, and internal HR teams to provide appropriate benefit plan options, rate analysis, etc. Vendor management. Assists with RFI/RFP project management and new vendor implementation. Annual enrollment support. Requirements 5 years or more of related benefits experience. Bachelor’s degree preferred with strong focus on numbers and analytics. Knowledge of State and Federal laws and regulations pertaining to Benefits. Must have strong inclination and comfort with complex spreadsheets and calculations. Experience producing deliverables in a fast paced, time sensitive, highly responsive environment Excellent written and oral communication skills, including large group presentations Some travel may be required. HR And Benefits Specific Skills Preferred But Not Required. Certified Benefits Professional (CBP) or CEBS Designation or currently in process. Prior benefits analyst, benefits management or benefits broker experience. Knowledge of FMLA, ADA, COBRA, ERISA, ACA, HIPAA. Workday HCM a plus.
