With a wide range of hot and cold beverages that meet virtually any consumer need, KDP key brands include Keurig®, Dr Pepper®, Green Mountain Coffee Roasters®, Canada Dry®, Snapple®, Bai®, Mott’s® and The Original Donut Shop®. The Company employs more than 25,000 employees and operates more than 120 offices, manufacturing plants, warehouses and distribution centers across North America. Benefits built for you: Our people are the heart of our business, which is why we offer robust benefits to support your health and wellness as well as your personal and financial well-being. We also provide employee programs designed to enhance your professional growth and development while ensuring you feel valued, inspired and appreciated at work. Keurig Dr Pepper Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and affirmatively seeks diversity in its workforce. Keurig Dr Pepper Inc. recruits qualified applicants and advances in employment its employees without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, disability, genetic information, ethnic or national origin, marital status, veteran status, or any other status protected by law.

Job Overview The myHR team is a customer-obsessed team that supports employees, managers, and other HR functions to provide simple, knowledgeable, and efficient solutions that drive operational excellence and business results. The myHR Sr. HR Operations Specialist - Retirement position at Keurig Dr Pepper is responsible for supporting the Human Resources service delivery model and by providing front-line customer service and support to employees, managers, HR Field staff for questions, issues, and problems related to all retirement policies and initiatives. This position carries out the duties and responsibilities of this function and ensures compliance with Company policies and procedures in addition to required federal and local regulations. What you will do: Customer Service: acts as tier 2 Benefits support for the US workforce in resolution of a wide variety of employee and manager issues – actively triaging and resolving escalated retirement inquiries from Tier 1 resources. Provide Tier 2 coaching/counseling advice to managers and employees, and work to resolve employee retirement issues quickly. Retirement Administration: performs Retirement administrative, transactional, and vendor management activities including supporting 401k and Pension Administration, coordination with Labor Relations, and monitoring/support of CBAs. Enters transactions, data, and employee information into HRIS systems as needed. Regularly conducts and reviews 401k and Pension audits, works with internal and external partners to correct any errors identified. Participates in CBA ratification process and implements any retirement changes associated with ratification. Project & Process Management: leads and/or participates in medium to large process improvement initiatives that require a basic working knowledge of formal project management. Actively reports project status points to stakeholders and management using project management standard practices. Other necessary functions: Models the Company values – team first, deliver big, think bold and be fearless and fair Has knowledge of multiple HR Services programs, including design, compliance and legal issues. Professional maturity and the ability to work under general supervision to organize and prioritize work, with high level of accuracy, and handle highly confidential information. Demonstrated ability in handling highly sensitive and confidential matters effectively and discreetly. Lean process oriented, with the ability to drive efficiency and scale without jeopardizing the employee experience. Creates and revises internal and external process documentation. Serve a support and/or documentation role in Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) preparation and audits of HR Shared Services processes. Ensures company compliance with all HR compliance and administration requirements. Follows all policies, procedures, ergonomic standards, and safety requirements directed by KDP and the department. Performs other job-related duties as requested by management. Requirements BS in Human Resources, Management, or a related field preferred. 6+ years of experience in a fast-paced, high volume, customer-focused environment, with an emphasis on interpersonal relationship building and employee relations. Union experience preferred Certified Benefits Professional (CBP) or equivalent preferred. Minimum 6+ years of retirement plan management experience. Impeccable written and verbal communication skills required. Familiarity with HRIS systems; Workday preferred. Familiarity with Fidelity systems preferred. Familiarity with Contact Center systems; ServiceNow preferred. Proficient with intermediate data manipulation functions in Microsoft Excel (Pivot; vlookup; charting) Proficient with Microsoft Office (Work, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) product suite; SharePoint and Microsoft Teams a plus. Expert collaborator who builds strong relationships with HR partners and business leaders. Reliable attention to detail and proven analytical skills. PHR/SPHR/SHRM-CP/SHRM-SCP certification a plus. Ability to travel up to 10% sporadically. Job Overview At Keurig Dr Pepper, we are quickly growing and expanding our capabilities around data science, data engineering and data operationalization to create a competitive advantage for our diverse business. We are looking for a Sr. Data Scientist to join our Global Data and Analytics organization. In this role reporting to the Sr. Manager, Global Data Science and Analytics, the data scientist will utilize statistical and machine learning to glean patterns and opportunities in the Direct Store Delivery (DSD), Commercial, and/or supply chain area. Data scientists at KDP are trained to be technical, operational and industry business leaders, acting as critical members of our business teams, helping to achieve above average incremental growth. You will act as both a strategic and technical leader whose purpose is to improve KDP's overall business performance through the analysis of data, development and deployment of predictive models, and the discovery of insights about our shoppers, customers, partners and competitors. Typical data science projects include demand forecasting model development, DSD operator service time prediction etc. Responsibilties:- Participate data science project development through the project lifecycle, from data sources gathering, data processing, feature engineering, model development, model validation, in-market test, to implementation. Under the supervision of Sr. manager or Principal data scientist, conduct advanced analysis, i.e. deep dive insights discovery, robust data pipeline creation, automation of model performance monitoring. Work closely across the Global Data and Analytics organization including Analytics Platform, Data Engineering, Data Governance and Data Product resources to help facilitate a collaborative, data science focused agenda. Navigate many multi-functional stakeholders and communicate technical results effectively to non-technical audiences. Requirements Master's or Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Statistics, or analytics related fields Minimum of 1+ years of experience in developing data science solution in a business or academia environment Has knowledge in cloud environment (GCP, Azure, or AWS) Minimum of 1+ years of experience in coding using Python, R Minimum of 1+ years of Experience with data extraction/analysis from SQL databases. Excellent knowledge of statistical and predictive modeling concepts, machine learning approaches, clustering and classification techniques, and recommendation and optimization algorithms. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to support high visibility projects. Consistently demonstrates good judgement, critical thinking, and creative solutioning. Job Overview Position can be based out of our Burlington, MA or Chicago, IL office" As a modern beverage company, Keurig Dr. Pepper (NASDAQ: KDP) was the first to bring hot and cold beverages together at scale. We are building on our position as the innovation leader in appliances to deliver the next generation of Keurig® machines to brew the love for our consumers and customers. Our Keurig® appliances implement advanced technology to bring our consumers a consistently perfect cup and we’re on a journey to engineer an even better cup of coffee while bringing our consumers the most simple and exceptional beverage experience yet. As part of our Appliance Global Product Organization, you will be at the heart of a team that is transforming our iconic brand for the next era. Keurig Dr Pepper is looking for a seasoned design researcher to join their Consumer Design team. This individual will build a comprehensive design research program to complement our existing industrial design and user experience practices. This role will drive significant value for the company by managing ALL design research activities associated with digital and physical product development and exert significant influence over our product line. The focus for the position will be on our Appliances Business Unit, which includes the Keurig brand, physical appliances, and IOT experiences. What this person will do: Responsible for identifying research needs to drive design maturity/decision-making across all in-flight new product development programs. Partner with consumer insights and product management teams to develop comprehensive learning plans that inform design, development, innovation and marketing activities. Determine the best way to generate consumer learnings for specific projects, utilizing a mix of external research partners and in-house capabilities/bandwidth (including hybrid models). Manage external research vendors, including scoping, project briefs, purchase requisition, project oversight, etc. When required, lead user research activities (recruitment, protocol development, moderation and analysis.) Maintain our roster of external research partners, driving continuous improvement in work quality and financial outlay. Manage an annual budget for external research activities across a portfolio of new product development programs and R&D activities. Manage our internal knowledge of consumers – ensuring we maximize the efficiency of our research investments by transferring knowledge between development programs/teams. Own the “Ease-of-Use” component of our Product Attribute Leadership strategy – including attribute roadmap, measurement system, and target setting for new products. Manage strategic research projects applicable across the products to develop categorical knowledge for all brewers and platforms moving forward. Advocate for customer’s behaviors and needs throughout the development process. Requirements 6+ years of experience across a variety of research methodologies, including: user research, human factors, design thinking, innovation, co-creation, rapid iterative testing, usability testing, etc. Bachelor’s degree in Social Science, Psychology, Design Research, Human Factors, or similar required Mastery of the new product development process with in-depth knowledge of where and when to insert research activities to drive consumer value. (Including experience with Agile, Rapid Learning Cycles and Stage Gate/Waterfall methodologies.) Experience working with physical and digital products and experiences. Prior experience with IOT devices will be highly desired. Mastery in applying methodologies to answer different types of research questions – with no pre-conceived biases towards specific methodologies. Proficiency in qualitative and quantitative study design, moderation, and data analysis. Proficiency in managing multiple stakeholders across a complex organization structure to achieve results. Strong oral, written, and communication skills. Can Present findings concisely and effectively. Ability to develop strong partnerships with cross functional agile teams. Job Overview Are you ready to join a growing, dynamic company? Keurig Dr Pepper is a modern beverage company, with more than 125 brands people know and love. We challenge the usual and always push beyond the expected. We are building a culture that is our competitive advantage – one that is growth focused, change resilient, collaborative, innovative, nimble, diverse and inclusive. Are you ready to do impactful work? You’ll coach and mentor leaders. You’ll create and implement ambitious people strategies. You’ll play an important leadership role in our diversity & inclusion efforts. You’ll work collaboratively with business partners and Centers of Excellence to deliver solutions that propel the business forward. Are you ready to grow? Here’s what will make you successful at KDP! We love passionate, courageous HR leaders who work with agility and are excited by new challenges. You’ll need consulting and influencing skills, a team-first, entrepreneurial spirit, business insight and analytical capability, and a heart for supporting the needs of our employees. Will you be the next member of our talented team? If you’re ready, here’s more about the job! Position Details: Based in Maspeth, NY. Hybrid schedule of 4 days in office and 1 day remote. Benefits eligible on day 1 to include medical, dental, vision. 401K with company match as well as four weeks (20 days of PTO). Salary will be based on experience and will fall between $68,6000 - 94,400 - $120,100 as well as 5% annual bonus eligibility. As a Sr Human Resources Business Partner, you will leverage your business acumen to lead HR programs and processes for your site(s) and / or region(s). You will consult with leaders on all aspects of people leadership to ensure positive employee / labor relations, supporting the needs of the business while at the same time ensuring the fair and equitable treatment of our employees. You will lead small to medium size projects and will track project goals and tasks, report on progress, make recommendations and help with implementation. You will also ensure consistent and equitable application of organizational policies and procedures across a functional area or location and execute on talent initiatives. You will act as a change agent to enable the growth & development of our people in the. Your Responsibilities will include: Coach and develop leaders in all areas of people leadership, including performance management and talent development, among others. Lead HR related projects and deployments and provide change management leadership where needed. Manage daily employee and labor relations and perform initial investigations of employee complaints and alleged policy violations, escalating where necessary. Partner with our COE teams to implement and monitor compliance with KDP policy, HR systems, and applicable federal/state law (including but not limited to 1-9s, personnel files, Worker’s Compensation, EEO, ADA, FMLA) and collective bargaining agreements. Partner with our Talent Acquisition team to track and report on open positions and help manage the position requisition process for internal transfers to ensure accuracy of postings and facilitate internal movement. Apply analytical skills to collect and synthesize data, formulate recommendations based on data trends and insights, and influence where needed to gain support for business proposals. Develop and / or deploy various communication materials (e.g., PowerPoint presentations, termination letters, and other employment-related correspondence). Travel may be required where your role includes the support of multiple locations. Requirements Education & Experience: Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources, related field or professional experience equivalent; Master’s degree preferred A minimum of 5 years of progressive experience in HR roles within fast-paced and matrix organizations Experience with collective bargaining, negotiations, and consultations with labor unions Advanced skills using Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Teams) Successful candidates will also demonstrate these additional qualifications: Proven ability to understand business goals and then design & implement new approaches, policies and procedures to affect continual improvements in business objectives, productivity and development of the HR function within the company Proven bias for action as evidenced through proactive, innovative and value-creating solution implementation Proven ability to navigate ambiguity within a complex, dynamic and rapidly changing business environment Proven ability to seamlessly transition between strategic thinking and tactical execution Proven ability to prioritize the most impactful work amidst multiple competing priorities Success in creating & driving effective and positive employee and labor relations for large populations of hourly employees in a distribution and / or manufacturing environment Success in leading and managing projects that require strong stakeholder management and alignment Company Overview Our offer Our people are the heart of our business, which is why we offer robust benefits to support your health and wellness as well as your personal and financial well-being. Job Overview The HR Sr Program Manager – HR Technology Delivery role is both a hands-on and strategic role that provides project leadership and support to the HR Technology team and the broader HR team. This role is critical in monitoring and controlling the execution of project initiatives, managing change, driving HR functional excellence, process improvement and providing superior customer support. This role will combine HR portfolio management with project management expertise to operationalize and manage projects from original concept through successful change management and final implementation. What you will do: Build and maintain an integrated HRT portfolio view of all activities and projects (Workday optimization, refinements, newly discovered issues, and annual processes) that connects with all HR technology-impacting activities and projects Ensure visibility to the work portfolio for resource assignment and drive work-related decisions in a timely manner Define and evolve the HRT program structure to ensure proper cadence and governance are applied to operationalize the HRT Activities include regular team and management reports and presentations about achievements, progress/watch areas, risks and possible mitigations Help the teams translate ambiguous goals into specific tactics and milestones to help them improve and accelerate their ability to execute Support and mentor project managers and program management processes at the governance level of HR and IT transformation initiatives. This includes developing project plans in collaboration with sponsors and stakeholders to execute strategic HR initiatives, distribute work among team members (including self, this role will also execute project deliverables), set expectations, and relentlessly drive to deliver projects with excellence, on time and on budget. Job Overview At Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) the consumer is at the heart of everything we do. Join the team at KDP and make a difference to consumers with one of America’s leading producers and distributors of hot and cold beverages helping to satisfy every consumer’s beverage need, anytime and anywhere. The SW Project Manager/Scrum Master oversees medium to large complexity/risk/impact projects. Responsible for assembling project team, assigning individual responsibilities, identifying appropriate resources needed, and developing schedule to ensure timely completion of project. May communicate and/or coordinate with senior project management, external suppliers/vendors, functional area management, or program manager regarding status of specific projects. May have international project scope. What you will do: Guide multiple software development teams to deliver technology solutions through effective application of the Lean/Agile principles and frameworks including SAFE, Scrum and Kanban methods Communicate and coordinate with senior leadership, external suppliers/vendors, functional area leaders and stakeholders regarding status of specific projects. Support the teams and stakeholders by providing Jira dashboards and reports while ensuring they are using the tool properly and efficiently. Identify roadblocks and recommend resolutions; develop plans to turn any/all project challenges into order for all aspects of the project deliverables. Ensure that release deliverables are clearly communicated to the team Identify risks, impediments as well as cross-team dependencies and support mitigation activities by working with teams and Product Owners Ensure that retrospectives produce actionable tasks; follow through to ensure that recommendations are implemented successfully and in a timely manner Facilitate discussion, decision making, and conflict resolution Assist with internal communication, improve transparency, and share information Requirements Bachelor's degree in engineering field 5+ years’ experience in project management or comparable experience. Fluency with Atlassian Tool Chain (JIRA, Confluence) Knowledge and experience with Agile techniques Strong planning and organizational skills. Demonstrated time management skills while delivering multiple objectives. Demonstrated influence/communication skills (verbal, written, presentation) with various levels in organization. Highly Preferred: Hands-on engineering experience in product development Experience in consumer products Knowledge of other project management methodologies BS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or similar Experience in Scrum on an Embedded SW / Hardware development project Ability to follow Keurig Policies and Procedures as well as our Operating Principles. Project management professional certification a plus. Company Overview Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) is a leading coffee and beverage company in North America with dual headquarters in Burlington, MA and Plano, TX, with annual revenue in excess of $11 billion. KDP holds leadership positions in soft drinks, specialty coffee and tea, water, juice and juice drinks and mixers, and markets the #1 single serve coffee brewing system in the U.S. The Company maintains an unrivaled distribution system that enables its portfolio of more than 125 owned, licensed and partner brands to be available nearly everywhere people shop and consume beverages. With a wide range of hot and cold beverages that meet virtually any consumer need, KDP key brands include Keurig®, Dr Pepper®, Green Mountain Coffee Roasters®, Canada Dry®, Snapple®, Bai®, Mott’s® and The Original Donut Shop®. The Company employs more than 25,000 employees and operates more than 120 offices, manufacturing plants, warehouses and distribution centers across North America. Keurig Dr Pepper is seeking a Senior Principal IT Engineer who possesses expert knowledge in multiple technical domains and IT systems design principles. The incumbent will develop solutions to problems of unusual complexity, which requires a high degree of ingenuity, creativity, and innovativeness. Challenges are frequently unique, and solutions may serve as precedent for future decisions. The Sr. Principal IT Engineer is seen as an expert in field and will assist teams solution effective ways of working through process, architectural, and engineering leadership. The role is responsible for the overall planning, execution and success of complex software solutions to meet customer’s needs and will focus on reimagining the status quo, finding value creation opportunities, and driving innovative and sustainable customer experiences through technology. Core Responsibilities Customer Centered Define clear and actionable problem statements to help teams deliver results while displaying a comprehensive understanding of iterative software delivery, capable of thin-slice MVP grooming. Leverage customer insights to influence priorities and roadmap feature development while advocating for and driving alignment between stakeholders in the development of acceptance criteria. Obsess over UI/UX patterns and seek to create world class, omni-channel experiences. Business Focused Work closely with product managers and story owners to design features and prioritize tasks. Own and prioritize the near-term product technical roadmap to deliver on business outcomes, quickly identifying points of leverage in complex problems or systems, and utilizing data effectively to define success metrics and measurable outcomes. Utilize balanced judgment in decisions about risks of both actions taken and not taken while innovating on ways to iterate faster in a well-managed way for the immediate team. Technology Driven Develop technical solutions to complex problems. Partners with IT functional stakeholders on significant technical matters. Understand and leverage technology and end-state architecture vision to partner with IT teams to drive comprehensive design decisions out of white space technical problems. Technology Responsibilities Delivery Centered The Senior Principal IT Engineer is the single point of responsibility for Customer Data products and solutions that are delivered through agile delivery methodology. Responsible for delivering the IT portfolio of projects, enhancements, and production support to achieve broader business goals and objectives. Responsible for end-to-end technical assurance, technical governance, technical best practices, reuse of technical assets, and the assignment of technical work. Work with other key architecture roles (Enterprise Architect, Solution Architect, Systems Architect, Data Architect, etc.) to lead visioning exercise and build strategic migration roadmaps. Guides the successful completion of major programs and may function in a project leadership role and fix integrations to support business after go-live. Platform Centered Experience in enterprise class integration patterns using ESB, iPaaS, Microservices and ETL tools. Facilitate design sessions with functional and technical team across the enterprise and external partners. Proficiency in cloud platforms like Azure, AWS and Google Cloud. Extensive knowledge about even driven systems, schema, orchestration, mapping, and ESB exception handling. Excellent understanding of ETL, databases, SQL; Expert in database engineering using Oracle and SQL development. Strong experience with data architecture and application architecture. Basic Qualifications:- Intellectually Curious and ability to deal with Ambiguity. You ask why, you explore, you're not afraid to blurt out your crazy idea or follow an email chain for weeks to find someone with an answer. Communicator & Influencer. You can communicate complex ideas clearly regardless of your audience. Passionate & Customer Focus: care about growing others and bringing them together around what’s possible. Enjoys the journey of building and has the desire and ability to connect with stakeholders. Appetite to learn new things or new technologies all while exhibiting humbleness when the time comes to ask for help. Excellent technical, diagnostic, and troubleshooting skills. Well organized, able to multitask and prioritize work. Enjoy working with diverse people and driving the team toward a common goal. Ability to coach, advise and lead a team as required Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Engineering. Master’s degree is a plus. Preferred Qualifications: At least 8+ years of demonstrated experience in technology domain leading transformative engagements. Previous experience leading/managing technical teams with a proven track record. 6+ years of experience in leading CDP initiatives (Salesforce CDP, Informatica, Redpoint, and Open-Source CDP). 4+ years of ETL experience. 4+ years of experience in Agile IT product development and management. Sr. Supply Chain Planner - Product Supply Team Our Product Supply team is responsible for all direct and indirect manufacturing of products. Whether it's sourcing ingredients, manufacturing our pods, or negotiating with our suppliers, the team works collaboratively across US Plants, Switzerland, and Asia to provide the freshest and highest quality products to our consumers. As a Supply Planner you will work with Demand Planning, Sales & Marketing, and Operations partners to create effective production and fulfillment plans of medium complexity with minor supervision. You will be responsible for ensuring the manufacturing sites or distribution centers are aligned to production and fulfillment plans and communicate supply constraints back to the organization. You will also develop weekly/monthly supply plans as an input to the S&OP process. Additionally, you will be responsible for managing various department reporting and ad-hoc requirements related to the products they manage. At Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) the consumer is at the heart of everything we do. Join the team at KDP and make a difference to consumers with one of America’s leading producers and distributors of hot and cold beverages helping to satisfy every consumer’s beverage need, anytime and anywhere. Position Responsibilities Review and revise production and fulfillment plans as required by changes in the sales forecast or manufacturing schedules Act as a liaison between Supply Planning, Demand Planning, Manufacturing, Quality, Sales, & Marketing and functions, communicating and troubleshooting issues, problems, and concerns Continuously review the sales forecast, analyzes production plans and inventory reports, availability / requirements for long lead time items to provide production guidance to the manufacturing sites. Generate a receipts plan to the 3PL partners to support warehouse capacity and resource planning. Assist in the expediting finished goods, when necessary, to support customer order fulfillment. Recommend and implement production and transportation actions when products are in out-of-stock or allocation situations. Aid management/departments on matters related to production or fulfillment planning and forecasting. Follow all Keurig Dr Pepper policies and procedures. Characteristics for Success Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Self-starter with excellent communication skills. Ability to be flexible and communicate proactively with global partners. Ability to multitask and maintain composure in stressful situations. Job Overview The Systems Integration Engineer will join the Keurig Dr Pepper Global Product Organization. The Systems Engineer will work on cross-functional teams, implementing next generation technology for existing Keurig appliances. The Systems Integration Engineer will lead the implementation of appliance technologies, sustain existing technologies, and challenge past decisions in support of sustaining engineering. This position will require both technical and leadership skills to coordinate a cross-functional development team and ensure all engineering work is delivered on-time in addition to meeting cost and performance targets. This position will have significant impact and leverage on current and future products and will be in an excellent position for visibility and growth within the Keurig Dr Pepper Global Product Organization and Coffee Business Unit. What you will do: Lead the implementation of new technologies into existing appliances. Serve as a primary technical interface with suppliers and partners to manage existing products. Develop/ lead new technologies with internal and external partners to meet appliance requirements. Partner with our quality organization to continuously improve products based on consumer feedback. Leverage a broad technical expertise across electrical, mechanical, software, and connected systems. Support and/or drive continuous improvement in our internal processes. Create and maintain design documentation such as CAD files, specifications, and reports. Provide direction and mentorship for peers and colleagues. Follow all Keurig Dr Pepper policies and procedures. Requirements Bachelor’s in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent experience 2+ years of professional experience in a relevant industry. Previous experience managing projects or programs with internal and external resources. Previous experience managing projects with high complexity and minimal direct oversight. Ability to maintain timelines and budgets across multiple partners. Familiarity with Lean and Agile development. 3D design/modeling (SolidWorks). Component/Assembly design analysis. High volume consumer product design. Design for Manufacturing and Design for Assembly principles and best practices. Experience performing dFMEA and developing Engineering Test Plans is highly desirable. Detailed component specification. Design for Six Sigma practices including Root Cause Analysis, 8D, A3, Design of Experiments, etc. Statistics as applicable to high volume product design and manufacture. Excellent oral and written communication skills. An aptitude for creating and presenting data-based trade-off studies as input to decision making. Familiar with Return-on-Investment (ROI) analysis methods. Ability to present technologies and status of development projects to management and stakeholders. Ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects at once. Demonstrated record of making critical decisions that positively impact the course of the organization. Effective at mentoring junior staff members. Company Overview As a modern beverage company, Keurig Dr. Pepper (NASDAQ: KDP) was the first to bring hot and cold beverages together at scale. We are building on our position as the innovation leader in appliances to deliver the next generation of Keurig® machines to brew the love for our consumers and customers. Our Keurig® appliances implement advanced technology to bring our consumers a consistently perfect cup and we’re on a journey to engineer an even better cup of coffee while bringing our consumers the most simple and exceptional beverage experience yet. As part of our Appliance Global Product Organization, you will be at the heart of a team that is transforming our iconic brand for the next era. Benefits built for you: Our people are the heart of our business, which is why we offer robust benefits to support your health and wellness as well as your personal and financial well-being. We also provide employee programs designed to enhance your professional growth and development while ensuring you feel valued, inspired and appreciated at work. This product development team is responsible for end-to-end research, design, manufacture, and delivery of all beverage appliances for the At Home and Away from Home market segments. We expect all of our employees to exemplify our strong company values of “Team First”, “Deliver Big”, “Think Bold” and “Be Fearless and Fair” in their daily work. To support you on your journey, our facilities provide state-of-the-art technology, equipment, and workspaces. We also offer a competitive benefits package, training, and mentoring by our executive team.

Job Overview As an intern at Keurig Dr Pepper you will be a part of the beverage revolution. You will be innovating, designing, testing, and marketing the way beverages are consumed worldwide. Each intern will have real responsibilities and will be provided opportunities to grow professionally. Come learn what it takes to succeed at an industry-leading company and help contribute to our ongoing success. For Summer 2023, you will engage and partner on innovative projects, heavily marketing & communications focused, to gain experience in a fast paced, cross functional team environment. You will receive mentor support for your professional development You will present a final presentation to your team, peers, and senior leaders to highlight your project work and impact on the business You will network and learn about other functions from leaders at Keurig Dr Pepper through a Meet & Greet series What you will do: Lead marketing & communications focused projects in areas of campus recruitment, TA operations and talent acquisition intern program management Plan and execute several events for summer intern program Drive engagement strategy with peers and organizational leaders for virtual internship program through internal tools and LinkedIn Spotlight Series Assist in compiling campus recruitment best practices research and creating recommendations based upon findings, including Campus Relations career website design Working with HR Communications Team to create approved recruiting event materials, including marketing flyers and company overview presentations Work to optimize hiring tools and technologies such as the applicant tracking system and HireVue video interviewing Create an on-brand video to celebrate our interns for National Intern Day Schedule meetings, interviews, and assist with HR Communications projects, as requested Follow all Keurig Dr Pepper policies and procedures As an intern at Keurig Dr Pepper, you will: Participate in meet & greets and lunch & learns with KDP executives and other organization leaders Receive professional development training such as networking, professional skills development and presenting Be paired with a mentor to enhance your knowledge of other parts of the business and build your network Complete a project from start to finish and present it and your takeaways to your team, department vice president and other KDP stakeholders Requirements What you must have: Must be an undergraduate junior or senior currently enrolled in a full-time academic program from an accredited college or university with a related major during the period of the internship Journalism, Advertising, Marketing, Communications, or related minor a plus Human Resources and/or Project Management experience is preferred Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail with a demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects, prioritize requests, and meet deadlines Ability to work cross-functionally, independently driven and a self-starter while working remotely Strong skills in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint required Visual and audio technical skills for video creation highly preferred Work visa sponsorship is not available for this position, including CPT/OPT. The pay range for this position starts at $23/hour. This is a hybrid model role based in our Frisco, Texas headquarter office. We incorporate HireVue, an automated interview tool, into our campus recruitment process. Please visit this link to learn more about HireVue and how to prepare. *We recommend checking with your campus career center for additional preparation resources such as InterviewStream, Big Interview and more. Applications wil be accepted through the end of the year. Job Overview Territory Sales Operations Manager The Territory Sales Operations Manager manages sales, operations and P&L of a branch to meet financial and company objectives for profitability and growth. Manage sales force in expanding market penetration and ensure timely product delivery and proper merchandising. At Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) the consumer is at the heart of everything we do. Join the team at KDP and make a difference to consumers with one of America’s leading producers and distributors of hot and cold beverages helping to satisfy every consumer’s beverage need, anytime and anywhere. Position Responsibilities Manage activities related to inventory control, warehousing, receiving, and customer deliveries. Identify, recommend, and execute continuous improvement initiatives in the sales warehouse and delivery operation. Develop and communicate the business plan, establish goals and objectives, monitor results and recourse as necessary to ensure the desired results. Develop and grow working/business relationships with all major chain customers. In conjunction with Fleet, ensure maintenance and fuel costs are at or below budget. Oversee the planning and scheduling of company transport vehicles to maximize revenue producing opportunities and minimize non-productive downtime and excessive overtime. Meet Key Performance Indicators (KPI) and maintain a reporting system to track and communicate performance. Design and implement operation strategies for greater warehouse optimization. Set, implement and monitor trade execution standards for Direct Store Delivery. Standards include account frequency, display diagrams, equipment sets, and account service levels, including merchandising standards. Ensure proper execution and implementation of all policies procedures with regard to picking, packing, shipping, receiving, inventory management, and distribution. Company Overview Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) is a leading coffee and beverage company in North America with dual headquarters in Burlington, MA and Plano, TX, with annual revenue in excess of $11 billion. KDP holds leadership positions in soft drinks, specialty coffee and tea, water, juice and juice drinks and mixers, and markets the #1 single serve coffee brewing system in the U.S. The Company maintains an unrivaled distribution system that enables its portfolio of more than 125 owned, licensed and partner brands to be available nearly everywhere people shop and consume beverages. With a wide range of hot and cold beverages that meet virtually any consumer need, KDP key brands include Keurig®, Dr Pepper®, Green Mountain Coffee Roasters®, Canada Dry®, Snapple®, Bai®, Mott’s® and The Original Donut Shop®. The Company employs more than 25,000 employees and operates more than 120 offices, manufacturing plants, warehouses and distribution centers across North America. Warehouse Supervisor The Warehouse Supervisor has responsibility for leading the safe, and lean management of the transportation and warehouse function at the Keurig Dr Pepper Concentrate facility. This Supervisor is accountable for inbound/outbound logistics, of finished goods, raw material, and packaging at the facility. They will manage and develop a team of 8-10 material handlers in a safe working environment. They will report to the Planning and Inventory Management function. Shift and Schedule: Non Union role. This position will work Wednesday thru Saturday 17:00 to 05:00. Flexibility is required to support the operation as needed between day shift or night shift with availability to work overtime and holidays based on business needs. Compensation: Salary Role. Paid Bi-Weekly Benefits: KDP offers a very competitive benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, 401k, Beverage Benefit, & so much more! Benefits are available to new hires DAY 1! Position Responsibilities Responsible for the overall direction, coordination and evaluation of the warehouse. Ensure proper execution and implementation of all policies procedures with regard to picking, packing, shipping, receiving, and inventory management. Train and evaluate warehouse staff on effective inventory techniques and daily tasks. Assist and maintain appropriate inventory levels and product loss control. Conduct physical counts of inventory and reconcile floor counts and inventory shipments. Schedule and manage warehouse team members within labor and budget while meeting the demands of the facility. Ensure compliance with safety codes, policies, and procedures of the Company and standards established by Occupational Safety & Health Administration (OSHA) and Food and Drug Administration (FDA). Ensure all equipment, including but not limited to forklifts, pallet jacks, and fleet trucks, is properly maintained and inspection practices are followed.
